title: Why is the Sky Blue?
text:
The sky appears blue because of a phenomenon called Rayleigh scattering.
\[I = I_0 \frac{8\pi^4\alpha^2}{\lambda^4 R^2} (1 + \cos^2 \theta)\]
As light passes through the atmosphere, shorter wavelengths (blue) scatter more than longer wavelengths (red).

title: The Physics of Fiber Optics
text:
0.1 Total Internal Reflection
Fiber optics work because of a principle called Total Internal Reflection. When light hits the boundary between the core and the cladding at a specific angle, it reflects completely.
\[\theta_c = \arcsin \left( \frac{n_2}{n_1} \right)\]
As long as the angle of incidence is greater than the critical angle \(\theta_c\), the light stays trapped inside the fiber.
